        public void run()
         throws Exception
        Description copied from class: Operation
        Runs the operation. Either the Operation.run() or Operation.call() method should be implemented; not both. Runs after wait-support, supposed to do actual operation

      • shouldBackup

        public boolean shouldBackup()
        Description copied from interface: BackupAwareOperation
        Checks if a backup needs to be made.

        If a call has not made any change, e.g. an AtomicLong increment with 0, no backup needs to be made.

        Specified by:
        shouldBackup in interface BackupAwareOperation
        Returns:
        true if a backup needs to be made, false otherwise.

      • setTarget

        public void setTarget(Address address)
        Description copied from interface: TargetAware
        Provides the designated target member address to which the operation will be sent.
        • This method is invoked on the implementing object before the operation is serialized and sent over the network
        • When an operation is retried, the target may be re-evaluated (eg a partition operation may target a different member after a topology change). setTarget will be invoked on each retry with the current target member's Address as argument
        • When an operation is executed on the local member, the local member's address is provided as target address
        Specified by:
        setTarget in interface TargetAware
        Parameters:
        address - target member's address

      • requiresExplicitServiceName

        protected boolean requiresExplicitServiceName()
        Description copied from class: Operation
        Returns true to force the explicit service name serialization for this operation, false otherwise.

        Usually, the method should be overridden if Operation.getServiceName() is also overridden, but it was not overridden in the previous HZ version, i.e. the service name was provided using an explicit external call to Operation.setServiceName(java.lang.String). This mechanism is required to maintain the backward compatibility of the serialized representation of the operation since the service name is not serialized if it matches the one returned by Operation.getServiceName().

        Overrides:
        requiresExplicitServiceName in class Operation
